definitions.text: showing intellectual penetration or emotional depth
far-reaching and thoroughgoing in effect especially on the nature of something
examples: the fundamental revolution in human values that has occurred
committed the fundamental error of confusing spending with extravagance

definitions.text: situated at or extending to great depth; too deep to have been sounded or plumbed; ; -Thomas Gray
examples: the profound depths of the sea
the dark unfathomed caves of ocean
